headline: Cyber Monday sales expected to reach record $13.2B: Adobe
summary: Cyber Weekend sales have transitioned into Cyber Monday, with Adobe Analytics expecting consumers to spend as much as $13.2 billion on this day alone after spending $10.8 billion on Black Friday. This year's total Cyber Week sales are currently expected to cross over $40 billion. Seana Smith and Brad Smith review this year's e-commerce and shopping trends that kick off the 2024 holiday shopping season. Barclays analyst Adrienne Yih, BMO Capital Markets analyst Simeon Siegel, and Mastercard Economics Institute chief economist Michelle Meyer all joined Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi on this morning's Opening Bid to talk about the biggest winners from this year's Black Friday event and how President-elect Donald Trump's new tariffs could impact the retail sector. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

This year's total Cyber Week sales are currently expected to cross over $40 billion. Seana Smith and Brad Smith review this year's e-commerce and shopping trends that kick off the 2024 holiday shopping season. Barclays analyst Adrienne Yih, BMO Capital Markets analyst Simeon Siegel, and Mastercard Economics Institute chief economist Michelle Meyer all joined Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi on this morning's Opening Bid to talk about the biggest winners from this year's Black Friday event and how President-elect Donald Trump's new tariffs could impact the retail sector. headline: Walmart Leadership to Participate in Upcoming Investor Events
summary: BENTONVILLE, Ark., December 02, 2024--Walmart Inc. (NYSE: WMT) announced today that company leadership will participate in upcoming investor events. Links to those with live webcasts can be found on Walmart’s investor relations website at stock.walmart.com.

headline: With a Business as Large as Walmart, Even This Small Development Ends Up Being a Big Deal
summary: On Nov. 19, retail giant Walmart (NYSE: WMT) reported financial results for its fiscal third quarter of 2025.  On the bottom line, Walmart's operating income increased by 8.2%, which was far better than revenue growth.  For perspective, Walmart earned operating income of $6.20 billion in last year's fiscal third quarter of 2024.

headline: The No-Frills Service That’s Delivering More and More Packages
summary: The growth of the e-commerce giant Shein has spawned a new U.S. delivery service called SpeedX that is leaving packages on the doorsteps of shoppers across the country.  SpeedX specializes in the small international packages that Shein has been using to send low-price dresses and T-shirts directly from China to U.S. homes.  SpeedX doesn’t hire its own drivers or buy delivery trucks.

raw.headline: The No-Frills Service That’s Delivering More and More Packages
